comments:
I get the following messages in my .log file 100's of times when I startup 
Eclipse 3.0M7 (the log file has over 5000 lines).  I have all of Eclipse loaded 
as "external plugins" and all of CDT loaded as normal plugin projects.  
My .project, etc files are readonly, since I'm getting them from our perforce 
server, but I don't think that should be an error on startup.  Most of the 
trace is in JDT, but PDE was also involved so I submitted against PDE.  I will 
attach the full log.

Created an attachment (id=8142)
Log file containing errors
Moving to JDT-CORE for comment - not sure why the project would be read-only.

Read-only-ness comes from perforce interaction. We are not allowed to modify 
any resources for these, thus JDT is failing to update project references when 
classpath gets initialized.

Aren't you missing some perforce support so as to allow you to automatically 
allow to write files when conditions are met ? (Lazy automatic write rights 
being granted) ?

If not, then there is nothing we can do, as if we cannot fixup the build order, 
then no reasonable build can occur. 

JohnA - shouldn't a change to project dynamic reference be allowed even for a 
read-only project ? Read-only here only applies to the filesystem, and not to 
the metadata.

Moving to platform for further comment.

We did not have dynamic references in M7. The perforce plugin will probably need
updating for 3.0, but this particular problem should not occur in M9.
